etymologies: 1940s: coined by the Austrian-born psychoanalyst Wilhelm Reich (1897–1957), from organism or organic + -one, on the pattern of hormone

definitions: (in the theory of Wilhelm Reich) a supposed sexual energy or life force distributed throughout the universe that can be collected and stored (in an orgone box) for therapeutic use.
shortDefinitions: supposed excess sexual energy or life force distributed throughout universe which can be collected and stored for subsequent therapeutic use
